Class Algos

  • java.lang.Object
    • Algos

  • public class Algos
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Matthieu J.B Capuano on 10/25/2017. This is my personal reference of all the sorting algorithms I have learned (except maybe radix) in Java.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Algos()

    • Method Detail

      • bubbleSort

        public static <T> void bubbleSort(T[] arr,
                                  java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        BUBBLE SORT: In-place. Stable. Best-case: O(n) Average-case: O(n^2) Worst-case: O(n^2)
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to be sorted in the array
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to be sorted
        comparator - The comparator to use for individual comparisons of T

      • insertionSort

        public static <T> void insertionSort(T[] arr,
                                     java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        INSERTION SORT: In-place. Stable. Best-case: O(n) Average-case: O(n^2) Worst-case: O(n^2)
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to be sorted in the array
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to be sorted
        comparator - The comparator to use for individual comparisons of T

      • selectionSort

        public static <T> void selectionSort(T[] arr,
                                     java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        SELECTION SORT: In-place. NOT stable. Best-case: O(n^2) Average-case: O(n^2) Worst-case: O(n^2)
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to be sorted in the array
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to be sorted
        comparator - The comparator to use for individual comparisons of T

      • mergeSort

        public static <T> void mergeSort(T[] arr,
                                 java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        MERGE SORT: OUT-of-place. Stable. Best-case: O(nlog(n)) Average-case: O(nlog(n)) Worst-case: O(nlog(n))
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to be sorted in the array
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to be sorted
        comparator - The comparator to use for individual comparisons of T

      • quickSort

        public static <T> void quickSort(T[] arr,
                                 java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        QUICKSORT: In-place. NOT stable. Can be made stable but out-of-place. Best-case: O(nlog(n)) Average-case: O(nlog(n)) Worst-case: O(n^2)
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to be sorted in the array
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to be sorted
        comparator - The comparator to use for individual comparisons of T

      • quickSortHelp

        public static <T> void quickSortHelp(T[] arr,
                                     int left,
                                     int right,
                                     java.util.Comparator comparator)
        Quick Sort helper method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to be sorted in the array
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to be sorted
        left - The left bound of the part of the array to be sorted
        right - The right bound of the part of the array to be sorted
        comparator - The comparator to use for individual comparisons of T
